page.title: 04Airfield at Gt.Waldingfield
page.content: An airfield used by U.S.A.F.Flying Fortresses was built in World War Two. It had three runways and about 3000 men lived in temporary accommodation in, and around the village.There is only one of the original hangars left and this has been resheeted and is used for storing E.E.C. grain.The control tower was taken down about ten years ago and just the base can be seen.The main runways were broken up nearly twenty years ago and the land returned to farming,mostly grain.Most of the perimeter road remains and gate posts can still be seen on the Sudbury road.These mark the positions where gates closed off the road when the runways were in use.
